title: Nurse refuses to cover unreliable coworker's shift because she won't cover their Valentine's Day shift in return, coworker is fired as a result: ‘I said no chance’
description: Valentine's Day is the day of love… so you better make sure you don't have a shift to work before making plans. Nobody wants to work on a day dedicated to love if they can help it, but work doesn't stop for anyone. Some folks might decide to not show up for their shifts at all or try to burden others with their special plans that they "can't miss," but this is your PSA: Your coworker's job is not your problem. If they try to guilt-trip you into taking their shift, remember that they probably wouldn't do the same for you, unfortunately.In this story, a nurse explains that their coworker is very unreliable and calls out frequently. This coworker needed someone to pick up her shift last minute, so the nurse told her that they'd pick up her shift if she could cover theirs on Valentine's Day. This coworker refused to do so, claiming that she had really important plans with her husband on V-Day… If that's the case, then find other coverage. Scroll below to see what comes of this coworker's fate.
author: Lana DeGaetano

title: Employee gets fired without warning for "poor performance" after doing the jobs of 3 other people: 'Fired because I put in too much effort during the busiest time of year and was fired when it got quieter again'
description: If you're working in a place that's understaffed, there's a good chance that management will make excuses about how they're hiring for the position, but though those positions stay indefinitely open and people apply to them, you can't help but notice: no one ever gets hired to the role.Meanwhile, more staff are experiencing burnout from the increased workload or just leaving for greener pastures, turnover is escalating, and now what was once a five-person team is down to two—and that's just in your department.Now you're doing the work of three or four other people and struggling to keep up despite working overtime (likely unpaid) and breaking your back to please your employer. Ask for a raise for the extra and exceptional work you've been doing, you're going to get denied. They're not going to recognize your additional efforts, contributions, or abilities. The point here, after all, is to save money by reducing staffing.
author: Brad Dickson

title: '[The] rescue gave us the wrong cat': Feline pawrent realizes 1.5 years later that the cute kitty she adopted is actually not her cat
description: Good meowrning, fellow hoomans and cat pawrents. We can't imagine ever mixing up our cats. To us, they're all purrfectly unique. We could identify them if you blindfolded us, spun us around ten times, and then put us in a room filled with 100 other cats. We like to think we could, anyway. But in reality, if you put one of our cats next to one of their siblings, we might not be able to tell them apart if it were a real expurriment.In the thread below, you'll meet a feline pawrent and the cute cat they adopted. They went in knowing exactly which cat they wanted, and left with what they thought was their cat. Fast forward 1.5 meowgnificent years of love and care, and after looking through some old photos, they realized that their cat looked different than the pictures at the rescue shelter! What a cat-astrophe! Scroll down to read the full story below and figure out what caused this meowrvelous mixup.
author: Blake Seidel

title: 26 Purrfect Posts to Skip the Silly Valentine's Day Drama With the Best Date Ever (Cats)
description: Well, feline fans, yet another Valentine's Day has arrived and we're still choosing our cats as our dates. It's okay, we actually prefurr it. Cats are way better than hoomans anyway. Sure, they may wake us up at 5 AM every day to feed them, but they don't text us for days and then randomly ghost us, or tell us that they "don't eat vegetables because vegetables are for women." No, our cats are there for us when we're feeling down, when we're happy, and are actually way better cuddlers than any of the hoomans we've met.So this year, we're skipping the Valentine's Day drama by staying in and scrolling through some pawsitively hissterical cat posts instead. It's us on the couch with our cats, a pizza, and reruns of our current favorite binge-watch. It's better than getting all dressed up and braving the winter weather, just to be disappointed a few hours later. If you've read this far, we prrrobably didn't even need to convince you anyway. Enjoy!
author: Blake Seidel

title: A little celebration.:)
description: This isn’t a real post…it’s just a little celebration because I haven’t had enough of those lately. Yesterday I got a copy of Furiously Happy translated into Indonesian and it feels so surreal. I just went through my bookshelf and in the last 12 years my books have been translated into Italian, German, Portuguese, Czechoslovakian,Continue reading "A little celebration.:)"

title: Error'd: Dash It All
description: Because we still have the NWS, I learned that "A winter storm will continue to bring areas of heavy snow and ice from the Great Lakes through New England today into tonight." I'm staying put, and apparently so is Dave L.'s delivery driver. Dave L. imagines the thoughts of this driver who clearly turned around and headed straight home. "Oh, d'ya mean I've got to take these parcels somewhere!? in this weather!? I can't just bring them back?"   Infoscavenger Andrew G. shared a found object. "I got this from https://bsky.app/profile/jesseberney.com/post/3lhyiubtay22r and immediately thought of you. Sadly I expect you're going to get more of these in the coming days/weeks." I guess they already fired all people who knew how to use Mail Merge.   Bruce R. "I saw this ad in my Android weather app. They think they know all about you, but they got this completely wrong: I don't live in {city}, I live in [city]!" Right next to Mr. [EmployeeLastName].   "I've got a vintage k8s cluster if anyone's interested," reports Mike S. "I just installed docker desktop. Apparently it ships with the zeroeth version of kubernetes."   Finally for this week, special character Vitra has sent us an elliptical statement about her uni application. "Of course, putting characters in my personal statement is simply a bad idea - it's best to let the Universities have the thrill of mystery! (From UCAS, the main university application thing in the UK too!) "   Keep warm. [Advertisement] Plan Your .NET 9 Migration with ConfidenceYour journey to .NET 9 is more than just one decision.Avoid migration migraines with the advice in this free guide. Download Free Guide Now!
author: Lyle Seaman

title: CodeSOD: Double Checking
description: Abdoullah sends us this little blob of C#, which maybe isn't a full-on WTF, but certainly made me chuckle. if (file!= null) { if (file.name.StartsWith(userName)) { if (file.name.StartsWith(userName)) { url = string.Format(FILE_LINK, file.itemId, file.name); break; } } } Are you sure the file name starts with the user name? Are you really sure? This code somehow slipped by code review, helped perhaps by the fact that the author was the senior-most team member and everyone assumed they were immune to these kinds of mistakes. No one is immune. [Advertisement] Utilize BuildMaster to release your software with confidence, at the pace your business demands. Download today!
